alert.note: Alert for Charleston; Coastal Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued September 09 at 7:31PM EDT until September 09 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK WILL EXPIRE AT 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...One to two feet of inundation above ground level along shorelines and tidal waterways (7.9 to 8.1 feet Mean Lower Low Water at Charleston). * WHERE...Coastal Colleton and Charleston Counties. * WHEN...Until 11 PM EDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Significant saltwater inundation will render numerous roads impassable. Properties may also flood. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Charleston Harbor SC MLLW Categories - Minor 7.0 ft, Moderate 7.5 ft, Major 8.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.2 ft, Moderate 1.7 ft, Major 2.2 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 09/08 PM 8.0 2.2 1.2 N/A Major 10/08 AM 7.0 1.2 0.9 N/A Minor 10/09 PM 7.5 1.7 0.8 N/A Moderate 11/09 AM 6.9 1.1 0.6 N/A None 11/10 PM 7.0 1.2 0.5 N/A Minor &&
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Visit water.weather.gov for additional water level and flood impact information.
